newsitem.title: USA: Syncronys sees Q3 profit vs loss.
newsitem.headline: Syncronys sees Q3 profit vs loss.

text.p: Syncronys Softcorp said Thursday that its preliminary financial results for the third fiscal quarter ended March 31, 1997 indicate that the company expects to post a profit of between $200,000 and $400,000, on revenues of between $3 million and $3.3 million.

These results compare with a net loss of $1.6 million, or $0.09 per share, on revenues of $606,000 in the prior quarter and compare with a net loss of $3.0 million, or $0.21 per share, on revenues of $388,000 in the year-ago quarter.
The company noted that it was not until the second half of the quarter just ended that it began to realize sales from several new key products.

It also said that its corporate strategy called for building a strong corporate infrastructure in the first half of calendar 1996, developing and acquiring several innovative new software technologies in the second half of 1996 and accelerating sales through marketing strength and additional new products in early 1997.
